rename.to: Feature Request: Support Nested Named Entity Recognition

body:
There are some variations of entity overwrapping. We have to deal with these cases carefully to implement the annotation feature.

Reference: [Recognizing Complex Entity Mentions: A Review and Future Directions](https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/P18-3006/)

issue.title: Overlapping of annotation for different labels

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
hi, 
I just wanted to ask if there is a way to annotate the same text for different labels. I have one part of the sentence annotated and tagged into one label category but the whole sentence also need to be tagged into another label and it doesn't let me tag.

body:
Hello @alokpadhi ,

Do you know any annotation tool which can annotate nested NER?
If you know it, please tell me for my reference.

> Hello @alokpadhi ,
> 
> Do you know any annotation tool which can annotate nested NER?
> If you know it, please tell me for my reference.

For that matter you can use [Inception](https://inception-project.github.io/), [Dataturks](https://dataturks.com/), [brat](http://brat.nlplab.org/)

I found inception and dataturks user friendly. But I will be very happy if Doccano comes with this feature asap.

> Hello @alokpadhi ,
> 
> Do you know any annotation tool which can annotate nested NER?
> If you know it, please tell me for my reference.

[Anafora](https://github.com/weitechen/anafora) could be interesting, too.

> > Hello @alokpadhi ,
> > Do you know any annotation tool which can annotate nested NER?
> > If you know it, please tell me for my reference.
> 
> [Anafora](https://github.com/weitechen/anafora) could be interesting, too.

I see, it's quite an interesting tool. and It looks more advance tool for labeling schema than the ones I have mentioned earlier.

I needed this feature for myself so i made an implementation which is fine for my use. Unfortunately i had to remove the update functionality because the outer NER would always juxtapose the inner NER in terms of v-menu. Right now, the outer NER can only be deleted after you have deleted all it's inner annotations. It's possible to recursively delete its children but feature is not implemented.

This version only accepts one level of depth ( 1 outer annotation and more inner annotations, as in the example image). 

I've also added the functionality to "round" selection to whole words.
I've included a zip containing the modified following files:
components/organisms/annotation/EntityItemBox.vue
and
components/molecules/EntityItem.vue

[EntityItem.zip](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/files/4739740/EntityItem.zip)
![Screenshot from 2020-06-06 12-17-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29649428/83940973-4469de80-a7f0-11ea-8fc3-2004c0aa3284.png)

PS: the text is random, source: https://github.com/minimaxir/textgenrnn/blob/master/datasets/reddit_relationshipadvice_legaladvice_2000.txt

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show 👍 if someone upvote, and 🤩 means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 👍
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 👍
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 👍
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 👍
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 👍
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 👍
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 🤩
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 👍
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 👍
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 🤩
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 🤩
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 👍
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 👍

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 🤩
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 👍
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 👍
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 👍
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 👍
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 👍
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 👍
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

body:
Rough design idea:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6737785/88457207-885b9480-cebf-11ea-92fe-d9608e6f1610.png)

- From the perspective of the backend, it's relatively easy to support nested named entities.
- From the perspective of the frontend, it's necessary for me to investigate which UI/UX is the best to use, how to achieve the UI/UX, and how to integrate that to the existing one.

issue.body:
Support the annotation of overlapping entities
---------
Please support overlapping entities in biomedical NLP this is quite common and would make the library a lot more useful. Would be good to understand what would need to change to implement this feature. If it is not such a hard task I am happy to help.

body:
Is there currently an alternative path anyone suggests?

I am working on a named entity recognition and linking pipeline. I would like to be able to specify the unique identifier inside of the labels provided by Doccano.

> Coming soon...
> ![](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/51e916d8bda88e3167fe52e150eb6565a8ffe4df19ebce4e9e0abc2eeb147bdb/68747470733a2f2f692e6779617a6f2e636f6d2f38313236633264323836373530303766643035633931366537636164656537312e676966)

Is there an estimated time?

issue.title: Support nested named entity recognition, relation labeling, RTL language, improve speed and grapheme mode

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
## Nested mode

![](https://i.gyazo.com/09e01d9152cad820238acbc52f4be3fc.gif)

Of course, you are able to annotate text without using nested mode.

## Relation Labeling

![](https://i.gyazo.com/79b6c31898c009629d22adc1362a2858.png)

## RTL Language

![](https://i.gyazo.com/02cc980a61ede7196029a2d84311ecd5.gif)

In the case of mixed RTL and LTR Language:

![](https://i.gyazo.com/bf2d0293562b805072955a4ec913a46f.gif)

## Grapheme mode

In JavaScript, there is not always a one-to-one relationship between string characters and what a user would call a separate visual "letter". Some symbols are represented by several characters. This can cause issues when you annotate the part of the text in sequence labeling.

For example, emoji characters like "🌷","🎁","💩","😜" and "👍" are represented by two JavaScript characters each (high surrogate and low surrogate). That is,

```javascript
"🌷".length == 2
```

The combined emoji is even longer:

```javascript
"🏳️‍🌈".length == 6
```

Therefore, If your text includes such characters, the start/end offset indicates codepoint offset which is different from a "visual offset".

So, I implemented the "Grapheme mode" which counts the character per grapheme cluster. As an example, let's say you select the text as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6737785/136881000-bed55db1-4407-4511-a4be-89692e2158c3.png)

With the grapheme mode, the offset is `(1, 3)`. On the other hand, without the mode, the offset is `(4, 12)` because it counts the codepoints.

## Large Document

I introduced the virtual rendering system to handle a large document. Now, we are able to annotate it(I tested about 1,000,000 characters document).
